title: rest
comment: Scripture recognises the need for physical and spiritual relief and stresses that the true resting-place of humanity lies in God, the Creator and Redeemer.

children.title: rest, physical
children.comment: The need for physical rest is recognised in Scripture, and provision is made for ensuring that people are allowed time for rest.

children.title: The experience of peace in death
rest, spiritual
children.comment: To be at rest spiritually is to find peace with God through Jesus Christ. This rest is promised to all who put their trust in God and obey him.

children.title: The human desire for spiritual rest
Spiritual rest is to be found in God alone
God promises his people spiritual rest
Spiritual rest is not for the wicked
God's offer of rest rejected by a faithless people
rest, eternal
children.comment: Eternal rest consists of peace with God, an absence of toil and tribulation and a final deliverance from pain, sorrow and death. It is promised as the inheritance of the people of God.

children.title: Eternal rest foreshadowed in the OT
In the rest promised to Joshua
The eternal state described as rest
Being in the presence of God
The absence of pain, sorrow and death
The absence of conflict and harm
Eternal rest is conditional upon faithful obedience
